text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus picreus is a species of mushroom in the Cortinariaceae family.
text.Description:
The cap is 1 to 2 centimetres (0.4 to 0.8 in) in diameter.
Microscopic characteristics
text.Habitat and distribution: Gymnopilus picreus grows on conifer wood and sometimes on hardwood. It has been found in the northern United States and Canada, and Tennessee; also Europe; fruit bodies appear in summer and autumn.
